headline: Seafood Chowder
description: This seafood chowder made with shrimp, scallops, crab, clams, and calamari is super creamy even though it's made with mostly fat-free ingredients.

video.description: See how to make a low-fat chowder that’s creamy and full of flavor.
video.name: Seafood Chowder

name: Seafood Chowder
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) container fat free cream cheese
1 (23 ounce) can fat free condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, undrained

recipeInstructions.text: Combine cream cheese, 1/2 cup milk, and garlic in a large pot over low heat; cook and stir until blended, about 3 minutes. Mix in condensed soup, undrained corn, remaining 1 cup milk, potatoes, green onions, carrots, parsley, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 25 minutes at a simmer; do not boil.
Add shrimp, scallops, crab, calamari, and clams; cook until seafood is opaque, about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This was excellent! I did use whole milk and cream cheese rather than the low calorie stuff. I added a little Old Bay seasoning and celery and also a couple Portabello mushrooms just for my own taste. The flavor was fantastic and is now one of my favorite soups.
This is soooo good! We like spicy so I used extra cayenne but otherwise followed recipe exactly. Used Shrimp, scallops and broiled lobster tail. Anything goes for the fish. Yum.

I absolutely love this recipe! I've made it several times. I usually double the batch and then package it for several lunches during the week. A tip: cook the potatoes and the carrots in the juice from the can of corn while prepping the other ingredients.

Awesome soup!!! So easy and simple. I doubled the broth. Change the seafood as you wish. I use cocktail shrimp as it easier to just peel of the tails and throw in at the end after scallops cook. Most Def restaurant quality!!
1lb shrimp 1/2lb bay scallops 1/2 calamari 1 can chopped clam We thought it was a lot of meat and could use more veggie. Flavor perfect.

This is heavenly!! The potatoes and carrots did cook in the milk and cheese while it simmered but next time I will boil them about 5 min right before I add them just so they will cook softer and faster. This is a hit at winter time gatherings!

Undoubtedly the best seafood chowder I have ever eaten. I did make a few changes to the recipe, however. I used one cup of whole milk and one cup of half-and-half. I also sautéed the onions, garlic and freshly chopped parsley in 4 tablespoons of butter. I cubed a whole haddock fillet and six large sea scallops along with one cup peeled and deveined shrimp cut in half. I did not use clams. I also added one tablespoon of Old Bay seasoning to the other seasonings.

This was fantastic. I omitted the calamari and the parsley. I added two fillets of diced tilapia, one tablespoon of Italian seasoning, and a tablespoon of butter. I also used a large can of clams,Patagonian scallops, and a bag of imitation crab meat.

This is my first review ever. I made this chowder mostly according to directions, but chose to differ the seafood a bit for cost reasons. I used a can of pink Alaska salmon, a 12 oz bag of frozen precooked shrimp, and three 6.25 oz cans of minced clams in clam juice. I also added 1/2 cup celery, a little more potatoes than called for, and cut the cayenne in half. It was absolutely wonderful!!! My family LOVED it and I felt like a gourmet cook. 5 stars in my book. Thank you for this recipe!!
Precook he carrots and potatoes so you don't have to simmer the soup stock too long.
Delicious!
Awww

Lots of interesting textures and flavors! IF you do it right. My wife can't stand shrimp (she's tried) and I can't agree with calamari. We used crab, scallops and chopped ham as protein. Added a dash of Old Bay Seasoning (very welcome), but the rest was to recipe. I have made this many times, and the real trick is letting the pre-protein mix get really soft without boiling, taking much more than 25 minutes, more like an hour. That hour of constant, intermittent stirring led to creation of wonderful sides, like my signature easy "garlic cheesy bread", until the veggies were JUST soft enough. You have to feel it while stirring. Finally, add the protein and keep it just hot enough to stay below boiling until it all cooks through. An arduous process to rival risotto, but similarly, so worth it.
Loved it

It was alright. It would have been way better if I didn’t use the cream of mushroom. It’s all I could taste and I only used 10 oz. I added old bay season and extra garlic. I’ll try again without cream of mushroom!

This was amazing! I ended up switching up the seafood a bit and adding a splash of sherry. I used the clams, a pound of shrimp and bay scallops and cut a piece of cod into good size chunks! Everyone went nuts for this recipe that it was wiped out in less than an hour
Delicious and pretty simple to make. Didn’t change a thing.
Everybody loved this. I threw in what seafood I had and went from there. Will definitely be in the rotation. We love soup!
Little hint of heat was a nice touch. Added more shrimp and white fish for the calamari. Will definitely make again. Everyone loved it!

I’ve made this recipe multiple times and with multiple variations of seafood and it turns out awesome every time! If you aren’t very concerned about the fat free aspect, I do usually buy the Campbell’s roasted garlic cream of mushroom soup which adds a bunch of flavor. I’ve also experienced with using garlic and herb or chive and onion cream cheese instead of plain. Highly recommend!

Very good chowder. Added 10 minutes to the simmer time as the potatoes were not cooked enough and added 10 minutes after we added the seafood (shrimp, bay scallops, salmon, haddock) as it was too thick so added 1/2 cup of water in the final 10 minutes. Added bacon when serving for effect and all were very complimentary of the dish. No salt & pepper required.
Great simple recipe! Kids ate it and liked it thats always a WIN in my book

Super yummy. Followed the recipe pretty closely but mixed some half and half with nonfat milk. Also added some celery. Added a bit of Old Bay seasoning for more spice. Served it with Naan or Shepherd's Bread on a cold, snowy Colorado evening.
Awesome recipe! I used cream of chicken soup instead of mushroom. Also used a 16oz bag of frozen, raw seafood... mussels, shrimp,calamari, and fish.... Very tasty

I used zucchini instead of potatoes and made my own cream of mushroom soup with butter, fresh mushrooms , milk and cream cheese. I also used frozen corn and a bit more milk for the liquid. Wonderful recipe!

Made a couple of tweaks due to COVID-19 shortages, but followed a majority of the recipe. This is DELICIOUS and I will make again.

Changes:
changed green onions to chives
omitted corn
added 1/2 c chicken stock (to reduce thickness)
used canned baby clams and baby oysters
This is a super easy and delicious recipe. I substituted old Bay for the pepper though, being that I’m from Maryland that’s just what we do. Turned out great! ?
Very Yummy!!! Added more clams and shrimp and omitted the scallops because I couldn’t find any. Will make this again. Everyone loved it!!
Merci this was good! I used Parmalat real milk, GV real cream cheese, GV real Mushroom soup instead, and everything else except for calamari tubes, which I could not source locally. So, so...good.
Loved it! I doubled the corn and added a variety of seafood. Entire family loved the meal.
Made this for a work food day today. Everyone who tried it loved it. I did use extra shrimp and crab as my store was out of scallops and calimari.

Ive made with a variety of seafood, but usually clams, haddock, shrimp, crabs and scallops. I just add haddock a few minutes longer than the rest. I also have used potato flakes near end instead of diced potatoes for a creamier texture.

This is a good base for a seafood chowder. However,to place an undesirable ingredient such as cream of mushroom soup is beyond my understanding. I wasn't about to waste good shellfish ,calamari, and cod. I made my own cream of mushroom soup,( takes only a few minutes) sauteed mushrooms in a bit of butter, 1 clove of chopped garlic,2 tablespoons of grated onion,a touch of sherry and half and half cream. I proceeded with the original ingredients, with full fat cream cheese,and half and half cream. I used frozen grilled corn from Trader Joe's,( again, I wanted the best tasting ingredients for the expense of the seafood).We had this for Christmas Eve and it was divine!
I make this every Christmas Eve. All our friends and family rave about it!
A little hot for wife’s taste could lower the pepper but I loved it
This was delicious…but didnt use fat free

This is soooo good. I have made it twice this month already. I used some tips from others, using seafood medley. I cut it into small pieces, added a slab of cod and some more shrimp and left out crab meat. (the shrimp in the medley are very small). I used regular cream cheese and milk. I am on special diet so I can't have potatoes or corn so left them out. The second time I made it I did add a can of cream corn and a small can of corn. It was awesome! I will definitely be making it again and playing with the recipe each time differently.
Everyone loved it
I was skeptical when I saw 5 stars. It really is that good. I made 2 adjustments. One, I added half of the cayenne pepper. Two, I only had crab meat and shrimp. It was awesome.
Delicious! I did not use calamari and it still turned out great!

I made this last night and will make it again. It was very hearty. I added one can of cream of mushroom with garlic soup. I also sauteed and seasoned the calamari, scallop, mussels, and shrimp, in butter, before adding them to the soup.
I'm adding this into our fall meals rotation. We left out the squid and made it with shrimp, scallops, clams and crab. Super yummy!

This chowder is delicious! I live in an area where some of the seafood ingredients are not readily available, so I had to omit the Calamari and scallops. I also left out the corn (more my forgetfulness than preference), and I added more shrimp to fill it out. I will definitely make this again, especially when I get my hands on some of the harder to find seafood.

Wonderful recipe! I made a few modifications - used scallops, shrimp, crab and clams (no calamari). regular onion instead of green, brown rice instead of potatoes, and left out the corn and carrots. All with excellent results!
Couldn't see the carrots and potatoes needing only 25 minutes to simmer before adding the seafood so sautéed them a little first. Also changed out the cayenne for Old Bay. Very tasty.

Simple and easy to customize - you can’t go wrong with this recipe! After reading countless reviews, my modifications include: begin by par-boiling the carrots and potatoes for 10 minutes, add additional cup of milk, omit corn and calamari, add pinch of thyme, reduce cayenne pepper to 1/8, and cut shrimp in half before adding them to chowder. This truly was delicious!

I'm not sure what I did wrong. I followed the recipe but my carrots and potatoes were still not cooked. I even did the last about 15 minutes more. I'm just now really getting into cooking so I didn't know what else to do. My boyfriend still liked it.
Delicious. I cooked the onion and garlic a little with vegetable oil. Then i added sliced bacon and the corn and cooked until tender. Then i continued to cook as directed. A big hit.
followed recipe but added oysters. A very hardy chowder. Loved it
I used Neufchâtel and I had cod and two small lobster tails and a can of clams. We loved it!
I doubled the recipe and am glad I did. Next time I'll add a little more cayenne pepper. Great recipe and not too much prep time.
I absolutely love the recipe -- its no fail every time! I make it on Sunday and serve Monday for an easy weeknight meal. I used more clams and shrimp and omitted calamari. TIP -- FREEZES GREAT!

Fantastic recipe! The family loved every bit of it. I made some changes such as no corn or carrots. No fat free products but all whole products. One pound of shrimp, crab, and clams and I also added clam juice. I also added a lot more garlic and onions because of our love of the two. It had a wonderful seafood flavor and filling. I will definitely make again adding more seafood and a larger quantity. This was my first time making a chowder and definitely want be my last. Thank you for the great recipe!
Excellent taste. Only used half the cayenne pepper and it was spicy enough for us.

Ok. This turned out great, but I did some things differently. Some in ingredients, some in technique. First, except for the milk I went all in with the full fat.

I first rendered about 6 sliced of cut up bacon. I left the fat in the pot and set the bacon aside.

I then lightly sauteed/sweated the vegetables first in the bacon fat, then added the garlic (3 cloves) and then spices for about a minute (I also added a heaping teaspoon of Old Bay Seasoning) prior to adding a half cup Pinot Grigio to deglaze the pot. Only after that did I add in the milk and cream cheese. I also added a jar of clam juice. I did not use the corn water.

I used a full pound of shrimp and a full pound of cod, a pound of the scallops, and 8oz. jumbo lump crabmeat and the can of clams. No calimari.

I used the bacon for garnish.

I would advise folks to make sure they dice the potatoes and carrots to a relatively small size to ensure it cooks in a reasonable amount of time. I also made sure the fish were bite size.

Next time I will try the non-fat route.

My wife and daughter loved this.

Oh my word!!!! We made this tonight and it was delish!!! We just used shrimp, scallops and crabmeat. We cut up 3 peeled red potatoes, no carrots, 2 cans of corn (drained), 5-6 cloves of garlic, used juice from a can of clams and substituted old Bay instead of parsley. 

Had some heat to it from the pepper but I wouldn't change it. Excellent dish for a cold winter night in the Northeast.

The chowder came out amazing! I made it for my parents and my nephew and they all loved it. My 5 yr old nephew is very picky too so him eating it all was very surprising. My parents said it was the best seafood chowder they’ve ever had. I made it exactly as the recipe shows, the only thing I did different was add Old Bay seasoning to it.

I was skeptical, but with the fantastic reviews, I figured this one would be worth a shot, and I'm happy to say, it was far better than I had anticipated! I bought a can of clams, fresh bay scallops, crab claw meat, and shrimp - way more seafood than the recipe called for, but I wanted seafood in every spoonful. My husband specifically said "ew gross, clams." but I was already invested in the project so I put them in my food processor and ground them up with a little milk. Warning - this produces a hideous, disgusting grey/green liquid that I almost threw out... but I persevered and you should, too. It'll be ok, I promise. My honest advice: Don't let the clams scare you: they add a rich, sorta sweetness that you wont be able to achieve without them. I pretty much followed the recipe but used frozen corn instead of canned, and like some others, added most of the juice from the canned clams. I did end up adding a little chicken broth towards the end because I was out of milk and used so much seafood that I needed a little more liquid. I also stirred in about 1-2T of sherry and it was amazing. Next time (yes, there WILL be a next time. The clam hating man has already requested it again. ), I think I will cook the potatoes and mash them up a bit to make a thicker, more chowdery chowder. So good!

This is so good! I've made it a couple times and this time used canned clams and the juice, scallops and shrimp. Like the flavor but not a fan of the chewy clams. Definitely use raw scallops and shrimp otherwise they are a bit chewy. Also I just used a couple small cans of cream of mushroom soup.
Simply awesome!

The only change i made was replacing the calamari with more shrimp. I also added a little Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning for a little salty heat. My family and I enjoyed this as our traditional New Year's Eve seafood dinner. Thanks for sharing.

The only change i made was replacing the calamari with more shrimp. I also added a little Tony Chachere's Creole Seasoning for a little salty heat. My family and I enjoyed this as our traditional New Year's Eve seafood dinner. Thanks for sharing.

I probably shouldn't give this recipe a rating, since I so loosely followed it! But I wanted to use up a can of salmon & a can of crab meat I found in my cupboard, as well as about 4 cups of watered down milk from another cooking failure. I also had about 1/4 cup of cream cheese I wanted to get rid of. I found this recipe and used what I had, left out what I didn't have (potatoes, cream of mushroom soup, corn, other seafood, green onion). It was so good! I am sure if you followed the original recipe, it would be out of this world!
It was a hit with everyone over Christmas. Nice flavors without the heavy cream guilt.
This was the best seafood recipe I’ve ever made. Tasty would be an understatement. I love this website and the chefs that’s share these dishes.
So good! And very easy to make.
Excellent! Will make again and again

I did not use cream of mushroom and I used regular cream cheese as well as added 2 Tbsp of butter. I also used 1 rib of celery and half a white onion but sauteed them ahead of time to soften them. I only used imitation crab as the only seafood and left out the corn. Yeah I totally changed it up but I know what I like! As it simmered I added 2 Tbsp of lemon juice to cut the creaminess just a bit.
skipped the clams and squid, went heavy of the shrimp and scallops

This was really good! I didn't add the clams or the cayenne for the kids and they liked it, but it was really rich for them! Next time I may thin theirs out a bit. I did add a bit of Bay Seasoning to just mine and that really kicked it up a notch for me! I will definitely make this again!

This recipe has a great base to start the meal! While I don’t use calamari or bay scallops. I add an extra can of chopped clams with the juice from the clams, mussels, & lobster. And I always double the recipe so I have extra to freeze after!

great recipe

Changes I made
1. used 12 oz cream of mushroom soup instead of recommended amount. 
2. added extra diced mushrooms
3. Added 14 oz. chicken broth
4. Added 3 oz Clam juice
5. added 1 onion
6. Deleted celery
7. Added 1 teaspoon Old bay
8. Cooked garlic, onions, mushroom, carrot in pan first
9. used 1 1/2 cup of potatoes boiled 15 min while vegetables cooking.
10 added 8 oz. andouille sausage
11. added lobster tails

Has just a little kick. I would definitely make again
Ex !!!!! i made this awsome chowder as written but changed the fish items to cod,salmon,crab & clams which were available at that time....
I made this with just a couple of changes- did not use low-cal milk or cream cheese, and did not add carrots. Other than that followed the recipe as written. Delicious!!

So delicious! I did not use canned clams, and instead used a raw clam, shellfish, shrimp, calamari, and crab mix. I also used about half the amount of carrots and added celery, substituted the milk for unsweetened almond milk, and full fat cream cheese. I'll definitely be making this again!
Perfect! I had a lot of seafood left over from a low g

I am reviewing this at 2 stars only because the cook times and directions are WAY off. I made it AS IS the first time and it REALLY SUCKS to lose $35 worth of ingredients, so I'm going to save you all the time and money.

First, there's no way potatoes and carrots are going to soften in a simmering (very thick!) chowder in 25 minutes. In the pot that you will put everything in, sautee all of the veggies *EXCEPT THE CORN* for about 10 minutes. Then add in the potatoes and carrots and enough chicken stock to cover. Cover and when it begins to boil, set a timer for 5 minutes.

Then you can add everything else in as directed.
Best seafood chowder ever! We had people over for dinner last night and they also said it was the best they ever had. Wow!
Easy to make and had a very nice comforting taste.
Loved everything about this chowder!! And it was super easy to make.
I made a few changes based upon what I had on hand. Doubled the shrimp and clams, left out other seafood. We loved it and it was easy to put together. A keeper recipe for sure!
Really thick and creamy.

Too much pepper (and my hubby likes pepper). We couldn’t taste much else. I would agree with others reviewers that it could use some more flavor. Extra garlic, oyster or fish flavor, and NO cayenne pepper. We sprinkled on sharp cheddar & garlic powder. If I were to make it again, I might add salmon to improve the flavor.

This recipe was delicious! I used 1% milk, low fat cream cheese and full-fat mushroom soup. I also used different types of fish than those listed in the recipe. The 1/2 tsp. of cayenne pepper provides a nice little kick to the soup, but may be too spicy for young children or those who don't tolerate spice well. I recommend cutting the cayenne to 1/4 tsp. or eliminating it completely. I will definitely be making this again.
I thinned it down with veggie stock and clam juice. Left out the corn & potatoes, used carrots, leeks, and Mushrooms. Extra shrimp-clams-oysters-crawfish meat-bay scallops. Amazing recipe!!
Decreased cream cheese to 5 oz., decreased garlic to 1tsp minced, added 2 celery stalks, seasoned with old bay, parsley, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Used salamon instead of calmari.

This turned out amazing!!! It didn’t last long at our house. The only thing I did differently was I used whipping cream instead of milk. I also added a can of chicken broth and used old bay seasoning instead of cayenne. It was so good. Can’t wait to make it again. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

This was my very first soup/chowder attempt. I couldn’t be happier with the result. I left out the calamari tubes, replacing them with more crab meat & shrimp. Following the directions and video made it easy and delicious.
Great recipe. I substituted white wine and brandy for any water. I also used sashimi leftovers and it is wowzer!!
Came out pretty good, but instead of crab meat I used crawfish and it was still awesome. I'm gonna try this again maybe with a little bit more potatoes.
I love this recipe. I didn't use crabmeat or shrimp. My preference was lobster, clams, scallops and cod. I also didn't add carrots.
This was a very easy recipe and very tasty. I am extremely critical when it comes to the outcome of most recipes, but this was a hit. I did add clam juice in lieu of some of the other liquids.
I made it as is. it was great!!!!!!!! next time I think i'll sub the calamari with fresh fish and add more shrimp.

Doubled milk, shrimp, crab, 12 oz scallops, 3 c milk, 2 c celery, lg onion, 4 garlic, 2 c corn, 1 can clams, 1 low sodium ready to serve soup and 8 oz cream cheese, no carrots, cayenne or calamari. Cooked veggies in olive oil, combined milk, cream cheese and soup, then added to veggies. Added seafood and corn together, simmered until seafood was opaque. Seasoned with parsley and black pepper.

I've made this twice now. We love it. I made it exactly like it says except I change the seafood. I use shrimp, canned crab, smoked clams, tilapia and calamari. I can't believe how creamy and flavorful it is considering how low fat it is. This is now a family regular!!

This chowder is everything you want a good chowder to be. Rich, thick, creamy, and bursting with great textures. I had to use a combination of fish and different seafoods due to allergies, but this is a great place to start. I added some hot sauce and old bay to my bowl, but my BF preferred his just as it was. This is a great base to customize so many personal flavor profiles. It also warms up great in the microwave and freezes well.

Made some changes. Sauted yellow onion and garlic in butter instead of scallions. Had to add more milk because it was too thick for me. Didnt use squid or clams. Had to add some salt and seafood seasoning, it was a bit bland. Very easy and not time consuming at all. Best chowder recipe ive used thus far. Next time i think i will finish it with a squeeze of lime in the bowl.

I made this chowder and found the taste to be fantastic. I did change the type of seafood the recipe called for, I used shrimp and cod, but I kept everything else the same. It did not taste like fat-free ingredients were used, which I found amazing. My husband and son absolutely loved it. I will make this again. Thank-you for sharing this receipe.

This is quite a good chowder. I did make some changes. I added pepper and salt, I doubled the garlic ( a matter of taste, I just like a chowder that has a lot of garlic) I added a bit more milk as I think it needed a bit of thinning out, and I didn't use calamari, just added a bit more scallops and shrimp. I found this chowder tasty and full of seafood. A lovely meal with crusty bread.
